remarks: Lemma for ~ mapdpg .  Baer p. 45 line 14:  "Consequently there exist numbers u,v in G neither of which is 0 such that y = uy'' and..." (We scope $d ` u ph ` locally to avoid clashes with later substitutions into ` ph ` .)  (Contributed by NM, 22-Mar-2015.)
statement:
mapdpg.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
mapdpg.m $e |- M = ( ( mapd ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapdpg.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.

mapdpg.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.

mapdpg.ne $e |- ( ph -> ( N ` { X } ) =/= ( N ` { Y } ) ) $.
mapdpg.e $e |- ( ph -> ( M ` ( N ` { X } ) ) = ( J ` { G } ) ) $.
mapdpgem25.h1 $e |- ( ph -> ( h e. F /\ ( ( M ` ( N ` { Y } ) ) = ( J ` { h } ) /\ ( M ` ( N ` { ( X .- Y ) } ) ) = ( J ` { ( G R h ) } ) ) ) ) $.
mapdpgem25.i1 $e |- ( ph -> ( i e. F /\ ( ( M ` ( N ` { Y } ) ) = ( J ` { i } ) /\ ( M ` ( N ` { ( X .- Y ) } ) ) = ( J ` { ( G R i ) } ) ) ) ) $.
mapdpglem26.a $e |- A = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
mapdpglem26.b $e |- B = ( Base ` A ) $.
mapdpglem26.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` C ) $.
mapdpglem26.o $e |- O = ( 0g ` A ) $.
mapdpglem26 $p |- ( ph -> E. u e. ( B \ { O } ) h = ( u .x. i ) ) $.
